insert into sys_dictionary (name, code, type, content, description, remark, state, activity, create_time, creater_id, modify_time, modifier_id ) values (#{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{code,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{type,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{content,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{description,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{remark,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{state,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{activity,jdbcType=BIT}, #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{createrId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{modifyTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{modifierId,jdbcType=INTEGER} )
mapper.update: update sys_dictionary set name = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, code = #{code,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, type = #{type,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, content = #{content,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, description = #{description,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, remark = #{remark,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, state = #{state,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, activity = #{activity,jdbcType=BIT}, create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, creater_id = #{createrId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, modify_time = #{modifyTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, modifier_id = #{modifierId,jdbcType=INTEGER} where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
mapper.select: select id, name, code, type, content, description, remark, state, activity, create_time, creater_id, modify_time, modifier_id from sys_dictionary where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
